page.title: 12OCCUPANCY PETT LEVEL
page.content: Many of the houses and bungalows in the S.E. corner of Fairlight and in Pett Level and the Pett area of the block are the result of holiday building between the wars.The area is within easy access of London, car manufacture was increasing, workers were beginning to be allowed holidays with pay.Plots of land were bought cheaply from local farmers.People set up other types of{holiday {accommodation.}Still to be seen at Pett Level are a former horsedrawn bus, horsedrawn van and a gasholder with doors and windows built in.All date from the 1920's. With the disappearance of farm labourers their cottages were bought and refurbished by{'incomers'. Many people who spent holidays here as children, have returned in{retirement.
